Accessor method: A method written for the purpose of seeing the value of
a private field from outside the object to which the field belongs.

Mutator method: A method written to modify (mutate) a field in an
object.

Cohesion: Something is said to be cohesive if all of its components are
tightly related. A method can be said to be cohesive in their own
context if they are limited to performing one task.

External Method Call: When an object of a class wants to call a method
in an different object, it uses dot notation, by using a "." between the
identifier of the object and the name of the method.
